snippet: Romeo Langlois, who was working for a French television channel, disappeared on April 28 after a gunfight involving FARC guerrillas, who claimed Sunday to have him in custody.
abstract: FARC guerrillas claim to have French journalist Romeo Langlois, who disappeared on April 28 during Colombian military and police forces anti-drug raid, in custody. (M)

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN; Jenny Carolina González contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia

lead_paragraph: A member of a Colombian guerrilla group said in a video released on Sunday that it was holding a French journalist and considered him a prisoner of war. ''The French journalist Romeo Langlois, captured in battle and wearing a military uniform, is in our hands,'' the guerrilla said, identifying himself as a representative of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC. ''He is a prisoner of war.''
